perturbation.original_text: MORPHO shall pay all charges under this Agreement, including the total Annual Maintenance Charge, within thirty (30) days after receipt of a valid invoice from XIMAGE.
perturbation.changed_text: MORPHO shall pay all charges under this Agreement, including the total Annual Maintenance Charge, within ninety (90) days after receipt of a valid invoice from XIMAGE.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the payment deadline to 90 days. While not inherently illegal, excessively long payment terms without justification could potentially be deemed unreasonable or violate standard business practices, especially if it deviates substantially from industry norms or imposes undue financial hardship on XIMAGE, contradicting typical prompt payment expectations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, or potential conflict with state-specific prompt payment laws (if applicable and more stringent).

perturbation.original_text: XIMAGE agrees to respond to any telephone call made, within 30 minutes.
perturbation.changed_text: XIMAGE agrees to respond to any telephone call made, within 6 hours.
perturbation.explanation: This modification drastically reduces the response time, potentially impacting XIMAGE's ability to provide adequate support and contradicting the reasonable expectations of service level agreements. While not directly illegal, failure to meet this extended response time consistently could lead to breach of contract claims and potential disputes over service quality. In California, for instance, failure to provide promised service can be a violation of consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential breach of contract, potential violation of consumer protection laws in some states (if applicable).

perturbation.original_text: No action, regardless of form, related to transactions occurring under, or contemplated by, this Agreement may be brought by either party more than one (1) year after the cause of action has accrued.
perturbation.changed_text: No action, regardless of form, related to transactions occurring under, or contemplated by, this Agreement may be brought by either party more than six (6) months after the cause of action has accrued.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the statute of limitations for claims to six months. This directly contradicts standard statutes of limitations for contract claims, which are typically much longer (e.g., 4 years in California). This shorter period could be deemed unconscionable and unenforceable in many jurisdictions.
